caption: Another overpriced place in DC. Met up here w a former colleague. Told we had a 30 minute wait until we could get a table- ended up being closer to a hour. Our server was fine,  although admittedly don’t think he did a great job explaining some of the dishes and not equipped to answer questions we asked. I ordered the half chicken and side salad and my friend ordered a shrimp salad. All in all chicken was fine -  it was well cooked but taste and flavor were just average. I am not sure i would go back... would rather stick w my go to places.

When you step into The Grill you’ll instantly like the theme and ambiance. I had the ribs which multiple servers bragged as being a favorite item. It only comes with a half slab so for the price it’s not really worth it if you have a big appetite. My date had a steak which was cooked very well. Everything was cooked good but they missed on the flavor and seasoning. Also the Mac and Cheese was underwhelming (if you’re a true soul food eater) If you’re coming here on a date you may enjoy it but don’t have high expectations.

This restaurant was one of my favorites. We live right next door, so we have visited this establishment several times in the past, and it has been always...on POINT.  Attentive, professional service by eloquent staff.  Well...not this time! My wife and I stopped by for dinner a few nights ago. We were seated right away, greeted by the waiter and promptly ordered a bottle of sparkling wine, a glass of Santory, and the crab dip appetizer.  It took the waiter a solid 15 minutes to return with the drink order. The appetizer finally arrived with an amount of bread which underwhelmed the dip, so we waited for him to return...until the dip was cold, solid cheese.  I received my steak in a reasonable amount of time, but alas, the waiting game to receive the knife.  Ordering additional glasses of wine and hoping/praying for additional toast to finish our dip was grueling. Our server/aka "the invisible man" appeared sporadically, as if evading the CIA, only to return at the very end rushing us to "finish up"! He had not even cleared the dishes, let alone, accomplished any other important aspects of serving! Appalling! This place is out of the rotation. And unless you care to eat cold food without proper utensils, order a bottle of wine and pour it yourself AND be rushed by a magician during your meal...allllllllll while having 20% gratuity added, visit the onslaught of other establishments at the wharf. $240 down the tubes... Suffice it to say, as we exited the establishment, we attempted to make mention of this unusual fiasco to "Justin" the manager who was unbelievably dismissive. I understand wanting to close down the restaurant, but my mouth was open. It was unreal.

Our server was super nice and attentive, as far as the food my filet was rare and my son's. I would say the best part of the experience we are in a whole different city and THE KIDS BURGERS WERE AWESOME. OVERALL 300$ LATER IS RIDICULOUS.
Exceptional

Had several items, none were very good.  Stuffed dates were ok, lamb skewers were awful, grilled cheese was ok, deviled eggs were awful, mac and cheese was ok, fish sliders were so flavorless, crab dip had no flavor, steak Tartar was described by the person who had it as dog food, sent back the squash soup and the hollandaise that tasted nothing like hollandaise., it had a odd Indian flavor twist, crab cakes were ok.  Cream spinach was good.  The braised cabbage was the best thing we had.  ALL AT TOP DOLLAR!!!  AVOID!

This place is...weird.  the servers no longer feel they need to revisit your table and the management...OMG...awful.  you spend 300 per visit and expect your food to not be cold.   I miss Reston town center!!!! This was good before but since covid, they five zero f'!
Loved the vibe of this place - very Miami. Nice decor, lighting, bar set up, and music. Food and service was great - really enjoyed the grill martini, appetizer sampler and the filet.
Delicious food and very friendly staff. Food was cooked to perfection.
Service was awesome, nice ambiance. But The crab cake and mac was terrible. They pour 4 oz for a glass of  wine.. probably won’t be back. Food is over priced.
The food was spectacular
I love mulled wine, The Grill takes 1st place for the best tasting Mulled wine in the DMV area.
Super waterfront dinner outside with Brendan--highly recommend the prix fixe "Mixed Grill." Justin & Joe-Jo were the managers with the mostest. Friendly, fun all around.

From top to bottom, this place is worthy of every star I gave it. From the fantastic and diverse drink menu to the buttery, soft ribeye and the crispy and sweet, sweet potato; this restaurant delivers a great dining experience.
Outstanding food and service! Managers are extremely inviting and strive to assure your experience is top notch. Thanks for making our girls night exceptional!
The best place to eat at the Wharf and definitely one of the best in DC. Service, Food, and Atmosphere are all exceptional. Our new staycation go-to spot!

If you are the kind to say, "I don't like fish that tastes too fishy" dont order their seafood. It is, in all ways good, full flavor! The land-based options were nothing to scoff at though. I had their sampler 'All the Bites'...next level, and the short rib... reccomend. Sides were great too. Top notch 'sit down' dinner.
Excellent service only matched by their excellent food. Great for a quick happy hour or full evening for dinner.
Pros: steaks were excellent Grilled sweet potatoes were great.  Cons Pricing 12% higher than expected pricing 20% automatic gratuity is turn off

I tried this place with my husband on New Years Day and absolutely loved everything we ordered. First off our server Jameel made this dinning experience impeccable. He was attentive, funny and made great suggestions. We started with the grilled punch and the finders gold, the drinks were great. We had the lamb skewers, the crab dip and deviled eggs for an appetizer. The skewers were impeccable as well as the deviled eggs we did not like the crab dip too much of a cheesy taste and not enough crab. For an entree we had the beef short rib. I had the double baked mashed potato (excellent) my husband had the sweet potato ( another excellent choice) the short rib was served with the bordelaise sauce. The prime rib was so tender you could cut into it with a spoon. For dessert we had the chocolate cake absolutely Devine. I would recommend this place to anyone.

It’s a good location and the host and servers are professional and welcoming; now about the food.  I was throughly unimpressed. 80$ for two salads and a appetizer dish of mussels. The water given to us smelled funny and tasted like it was from the sink, the salad.. a simple Cesar salad was butchered with the overwhelming taste of anchovies and lemon .. way too much lemon. The mussels were mediocre at best, they didn’t taste fresh.  I don’t eat beef or pork, so my options were limited  I will mention that all this was addressed with the waiter. He apologized for the quality of the food and brought out a single scoop of ice cream as compensation.  All in all, I don’t believe I’ll be going back.
Good customer service. Food was ok. Love the bake sweet potato

The view is amazing.  Indoor and outdoor dining offered. Good menu items.  Kids menu available. Mask required for entry.  Staff is really nice. Mandatory 20% tip after 4 PM...just to be clear. The salads were good.

From the moment i walked through the doors to leaving with a satisfied stomach, I had a splendid time at the Grill! Gorgeous atmosphere, and our host Allam made me feel all the more welcome, going above and beyond to ensure my time there was delightful.  The food (I ordered the express steak and fries) was quite flavorful, with a special sauce that paired nicely with each bite without being overbearing. The Herbed fries were just simply amazing! They have a nice texture to them ( not to crsipy, not to soft) and is easily some of the best fries I've ever had.  Next, the hibiscus sorbet. (I must say beforehand, that I'm not big on dessert) BUT, it was good.  Really potent, a bit tart, but just REALLY sweet.  In conclusion: make a reservation asap so that The Grill can bless your soul!
The food is fantastic!
Our waiter Jameel & manager JoJo were simply amazing! The food...even more amazing. I highly recommend! We will def come back. Thank you!

This place is wonderful! The food is delicious and the presentation is beautiful! Service is excellent, with an awesome ambience and nice view. The staff is very professional and attentive. I will be going back often, especially to sit at the bar after this pandemic!
Great date night.  Drinks are EXCELLENT!!! SERVICE IS A1.

Amazing food the service absolutely great! Bryan and Tori treated us too well and it was very pleasant! We had the cheese crab dip- very good with a zesty kick to it. The fried cheese - fried to perfection :) & the three layered chocolate cake melts in your mouth. Brunch with river front view :)
Alam is wonderful!

Expensive food with poor quality meat. My steak was so hard that I was feeling chewing a piece of plastic. It dint have no flavor and they rip me off on a glass of wine for 20 dollars, Which was the cheapest red wine. Not that many options as well. Definitely not coming back.
Very good. 🤤👍
Just found out about this place and I can't wait to go back. The food, drinks and customer service was great! The Oysters Rockefeller and Branzino was delish :)
Currently my absolute favorite restaurant, it’s our “girls brunch” go to. It’s a lil pricey, but worth every dime.
Excellent

Not gonna lie.... It is expensive depending on your wallet size. Now if you ask me is it worth it I would say absolutely yes... Great staff great environment great food. I love the experience they provide. Dine here diners.

Honestly, shouldn’t be first choice for a restaurant in DC. My family and I spent this past weekend in DC. We went to wharf and saw this place. We thought it wasn’t too fancy, until they served our food. They don’t have American cheese when we’re in the capital of the United States. They don’t have Caesar dressing, and they put seasoning on my burger. I was definitely not impressed.
Definitely a vibe!!

(Translated by Google) A restaurant with excellent service has Bilingual staff !! Their food is delicious and varied, super nice. Thank you so much!  A restaurant with excellent service has Bilingual staff !! Their food is delicious, super nice !! Thank so much!  (Original) Un restaurante con un excelente servicio tienen personal Bilingüe!! Su comida es deliciosa y variada, súper agradable. Muchas Gracias!  A restaurant with excellent service has Bilingual staff !!  Their food is delicious, super nice!! Thank so much !

SERVICE. James Beard-ish. So refreshing.  BITES. Flavorful. Majorly.  COCKTAILS. The Gato's Meow. Please sip & ssvor this!  Tbh, I wrote a more detailed review while I was at The Grill. But, I neglected to submit it after our entrées arrived. Who has time for typing when you're having a full sensory flavor experience 🤷🏽‍♀️ I'm glad to know this is an option on this side of the city.  I shall return. MOST DEFINITELY.
Amazing!
Sooooo Good!! Amazing fried chicken and great mac n cheese. Outdoor seating with good customer service. Good parking. Nice atmosphere in the Potomac location

It’s a NO for me. Very cute vibe, and a nice server, but that’s all it’s got going for it. I would stick to cocktails and avoid the wine. It was an absolute stingy 3 oz pour for a $20 glass of Pinot Grigio - no thanks. We complained, but I guess weren’t pushy enough. The burger was decent but dry and overcooked. I did really like the cocktails! Just skip wine here for sure that’s where they rip you off. They were having trouble with taking credit cards and only taking cash. Toasttab was working at the place we went after, just saying!
Great location, Perfect Martini was perfect!!
The food here was excellent because my family had the best experience with their food and their was no nothing wrong with their food. Compliments to the chiefs of The Grill.
My 2nd dining experience at The Grill was great with delicious food and excellent service. I highly recommend the Ribeye and the Halibut.

Service and wine was fine, but much like other reviews, the food does not stack up, even when adding the location and service (automatic 20% gratuity after 4pm). There are simply better places right next door. Ordered Halibut with risotto, and with (*moderate) expectations at nearly $40 per plate, the risotto tasted like chewy chlorinated rice-a-roni, except worse. Burger was good, but not as advertised, menu says sun dried tomatoes on the burger. When it came out, regular tomatoes. Not a deal breaker per say, but when asked for more detail as for the reason (ran out, changed menu, any offering of peace, etc.), we received a confused apology and not seeing our server again until the check. It's unfortunate to see, but most people have certain expectations of what 40+ dollar/plate should be (no nonsense, as advertised, and generally good) and The Grill was not it.
Experience was poor long wait for poor quality food! I ordered crab cake worst choice taste nothing but filler too much garnish not enough attention to quality of food. I will not be back!
This place is awesome. They’re pretty pricey, but you get what you pay for. Their ribs are phenomenal and their crab dip was the best I’ve ever had. The location is great too.

Poor service. Came for my friends bday ordered a pretty pricy bottle of champagne just wanted a few appetizers before going somewhere else to party. They basically said it was full dining only and we had to order an entre or they would be forced to close us out. We had spent like 250USD between the two of us and they were basically still throwing us out over not ordering entrees. Mind you we made reservations, there was no bar due to COVID, and it was chilly outside so we really had no choice but to sit inside. I felt so disrespected and disappointed they ruined his 30th MILESTONE bday dinner killed the vibe we wound up calling it a night. Manager was very rude before kicking us out. Waitress said they didn't have tastings for champagnes by the bottles only by the glass. I asked her if they had any champagnes by the bottle also by the glass and she said no. Then proceeded to turn to the champagne by the glass page which had some that were also by the bottle and didn't apologize or acknowledge her error. Very dismissive mandatory 20% gratuity. They sent him a scoop of ice cream with a candle in it and were intently watching us to see if we'd eat it we just felt sketched out and left.

Definitely not going back and not recommending to anyone......lots of reasons. Idea of 3 course sharing was awful.no bread no table cloth no folded napkins and sharing 3 course and 20٪؜ tip added for party of 3 is like good cafeteria but pricey as a fine dining.... Very bad experience.....

This is a great restaurant. The staff was excellent. Brian our waiter took very good care of my Husband and I. The Halibut and the Garden Salad was wonderful.  We shared a beautiful view by the Waterfront. The food was Awesome. Definitely a wonderful place to Dine!!! ❤️😍❤️😍❤️
Great food.  Try the mimosas!
Rude stuff at the front desk

Had a great experience here! The deviled eggs were fantastic, and the Grill Martini was one of the best martinis I have ever had. Also, the manager Jojo was delightful. I definitely would recommend checking this place out if you're in the area.

Though this restaurant has nice decorum, the level of professionalism by the hostess, Daisy, is deplorable. Upon giving my name to be out in the wait list, I kindly asked for outside seating. When returning to be seated after a 45 minute wait, I was told that outside seating was not available for another 45 minutes, and that only inside seats was available. The hostess showed a bad attitude and was not helpful, at all, with at least trying to allow me and my party of five to enjoy outside seating. I am planning to tell of my friends and colleges to not support this restaurant.

Food was not good.  Ambience and service were nice.  We had crab cake, snapper,  salmon, skirt steak (kids) and pork ribs (kids). The cheese crab dip was decent,  but the bread was burnt. They brought us more and it was a little better.  Food was definitely not worth the price we paid.  But,  it was the only restaurant open near the wharf. Won't be back.
Food was great! The chef is wonderful! Manager Joe Joe turned what could of been a bad customer service experience into a magnificent experience. Definitely will dine again when I'm in DC.
Elena, Indigo, Welsley and Chelsea ALL awesome. Beef tartare is EXCEPTIONAL!!!

The view, the customer service, the food, the paper straws haha .. just amazing !! They have done a tremendous job despite this pandemic 👏🏾👏🏾! We were seated outside, the weather was nice and cool at night. The waiter was the best.  The sweet potato wedges are to die for 😋
The restaurant was nice and Ebony our server was great.

Amazing service! Very diverse staff. The food was presented well. The decor is pristine and the restaurant is clean (even the bathroom). When you come here you’re paying for the (extremely expensive) food but also the amazing experience of going to a restaurant that cares about the customer’s overall experience. Honestly, not my taste in food. I like a lot more spice and seasoning but if you’re looking for a good, hearty steak this is the place.

Loved the location by the water and a fantastic breeze. The service was excellent and ambiance was on point for the purpose I was there. Only issue was the food we ordered for entrée wasn't good enough for the price, ribeye steak. The grilled cheese was great for the appetizer. Fries were too much but good. Will probably be back again
Very Nice atmosphere and delicious food. Got a drink called Cosmo Blanco and I'd highly recommended it!
HORRIBLE!  (The nicest thing I can say)
General Manager is Awesome
Little pricey, but very delicious

Decent food and drinks. Ribeye and twice baked potato and oysters are a must try.  Displaying a 20% gratituty after 4pm sign was off putting, but our server was acceptable. At least they didn’t demand that everyone in the party order an entree. Would probably go here again.
Even with weird Coronavirus guidelines, the service is great and the food is awesome. Wearing mask is mandatory with indoor and outdoor seating.
Took the family here to have lunch and will definitely eat at The Grill again. The food was amazing and our server Jackson was great.
Excellent food and service
No service, very rude staff. We just left to go to another restaurant. bye

The food is okay, the chicken was very dry, but the red snapper is soon good, worth it. But i had a piece of brown hair in my fries, my waiter forgot to even put in our lamb chops, so we didn't even get our appetizer, the waiter forgot my drink for 10mins comes back around, says everything good. Forgot all about my soda. Then the manager or w.e he was, was very rude, pulled me aside, said if i head to the bathroom you must have your mask on , or he will be fined, well than maybe put some signs up around the restaurant about wearing a mask, instead of just outside, cuz it makes it look like you only have to wear a mask when your being waited to seat. Then when I said , I saw other people walking to the restroom without a mask on, he said so does that mean your gonna follow them. Like seriously, totally rude. Might be good idea to have signs up around the restaurant, wear mask when not sitting at the table. Totally rude, he could of approach me alot better than being rudeee.
Food was good, portions small. Very expensive.

Went there on Saturday night with my girlfriend, the service was great, along with the drinks. What really disappointed me was their tomahawk steak which was a no roll grade and couldn’t chew the meat because of how much nerves and cartilage was in the steak, couldn’t finish it and had to send more then half of it back. And when I told the manger about it, he gave me  a desert. I wasn’t looking for free food but that seems to be the common practice, “when customers are not happy just give them something sweet.”

Didn’t even get in all the way with my mom and dad who are older without the host screaming oput on a mask. Mind you now the mask was on their face they just had to put the hood over their nose. We were trying to decide if we wanted to sit outside or inside and she seemed agitated with us trying to decide. She then reminded us twice that it’s a 2 hour time limit, like we didn’t hear the first time. We decided to leave because of that rude experience. This was our first time.
Superb vibes and very friendly service. The menu was crisp and delightful. Will clearly recommend this place to friends. Fair rates and big meals. Good job.
(Translated by Google) Cosí place  (Original) Cosí place
Love the Grill Punch, brunch here❤

The Grill at the Wharf is a nice place to visit especially during the summer. This location practices social distancing and has an outdoor patio area. There was a longer wait time because they only had outdoor seating at the time. I had the Grilled cauliflower and King Salmon with Grill Punch 🔥. The food was okay, but I would recommend more vegan options. The Grill Punch alone is ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐!

Food taste amazing(Odered the Grill burger entree, mushrooms and spinach both sides) We came in today as the city is into its second phase of reopening day three and our hostess...not friendly @ all quite rude.... my husband thought we had to only do patio seating when actually we could sit inside.....apparently it was a crime we didn't know....one of the managers comes over to help her assist us and he gets us menus...He asks "Will you need a menu for your kid or she won't eat?" provide a menu and we'll decide that...second time dining in down here @ the Wharf a great view but service here isn't to holler about
Ok... the oysters WOW (pss Amazing staff) Thanks!

(Translated by Google) 5 stars for the restaurant, I just wanted to put one to emphasize that., Tuesday I was there in the afternoon with my family. All great order a kingsalmon wauuuu q delicious they all ate hamburgers both my two children and my wife !! I loved the food !!!! Nice place in family and to padarla well the only thing was that as I eat my salmon with my hands and fingers logical that needed my tools! Omg the children and my wife never came, the food came less the napkin and their cutlery omg, what happened they were forgotten or what .. I was so upset that I wanted to enjoy everything, give my food and my drink, but it was not like that !! I asked the foodrunner for my cutlery, he immediately answered my call, no complaint from Asia !! I started to enjoy my salmon as if nothing happened !! Something clear those who accompanied me clearly could use their hands and fingers were fries and hamburger !!!! But I ate well and my drink ended up with the bite in my throat wauuu omg what happened at the table they sat down after my family and I had what was necessary to enjoy their food but I did not pray that someone would bring me another drink!! Well when they finally saw me fart 2 at a time so as not to be with the problem !! Thanks good food, I'm not complaining, I work a lot in a restaurant and I loved serving customers with good taste and bad taste to be a good server, you don't look race, color or economic level !!! I have nothing against anyone else alone (improve as they are) thousand thanks! I will return that without a doubt good foodaaaaaa good atmosphere excellent service !!! Nothing else that sometimes we forget that there are clients in need of attention not 100% excellent but of normal quality as good workers in such a beautiful restaurant! Blessings  (Original) 5 estrellas para el restaurante ,nada mas quise poner una para recalcar que ., el martes estube ahi en la tarde con mi familia. Todo estupendo ordene un kingsalmon wauuuu q delicioso ellos todos comieron hamburgesas tanto mis dos niños y mi esposa !! Me encanto la comida !!!! Lindo lugar en familia y para padarla bien lo unico fue que como comere mi salmon con mis manos y dedos lógico que necesitava mis utencilios !! Omg nunca llegaron ni los de los niños ni mi esposa la comida llego menos la servilleta y sus cubiertos omg q paso se olvidaron o que.. estava tan disgusto que yo queriendo disfrutar a todo dar mi alimento y mi bebida mas no fue asi !! Pedi al foodrunner por mis cubiertos es de inmediato atendio mi llamado no hay queja asia el !! Empese a disfrutar mi salmon como si nada pasara !! Algo claro los q me acompañaban claramente podían usar sus manos y dedos eran papas fritas y hamburguesa!!!! Pero yo bueno comi y mi bebebida se termino estava con el bocado en mi gargantaa wauuu omg que paso en la mesa que se sentaron despues de mi familia y yo enfrente tubieron lo necesario para disfrutar su comida mas yo no y rogava q alguien me trajera otra bebida!! Bueno cuando porfin me vieron pedo 2 de una ves para no estar con el problema!! Gracias buena comida no me quejo trabaje mucho en restaurante y me encanto atender clientes con buen gusto y de mal gusto para ser buen servidor no se mira raza color o nivel económico !!! No tengo nada encontra de nadie mas solo ( mejoren en lo que uedan )  mil gracias!! Volveré eso sin duda buena comidaaaaaaa bien ambiente excelente servicio!!! Nada mas q aveses se nos olvida que hay clientes con la necesidad de una atencion no 100% excelente pero a calidad normal como buenos trabajadores de un restaurante tan hermoso !! Bendiciones

The Grill at the Wharf is a perfect place for steak and seafood lovers. Although you can only sit outside the beautiful view and breeze was nice. The sun is bright so shades are a must unless you get a table in the shade. No worries once the sun starts to set the atmosphere is perfect. The food was delicious from the beginning to the end. The crab dip was uniquely loose and had a citrus flavor but plenty of lump crab meat to go around. The Ribeye was seasoned to perfection. However, the amount of marble could be deemed overwhelming if the ribeye isn't your favorite cut of steak. Add a crabcake for a surf and turf experience. The crabcake was light and tasty. The creamy spinach and twice baked potatoes matched perfectly. The serving size is shareable so come with a big appetite. A perfect spot for a special occasion, date with your spouse or girl's night out. Ps. Be prepared to wait due to limited seating capacity because of COVID19 but the food is worth the wait #fallynsfoodieexcursions #fallynsfoodieexcursionscovid19edition #thegrilldc #dcwharf #dateday
Brand new place but already one of the best restaurants in DC! Great service, incredible food and interior with Miami style vibes, but on Potomac river. I highly recommend it!

Thank you for such a wonderful experience! I will be back w/ many more business associates, friends and family. This place serves as the epitome of customer service; I want to spend my money HERE!! Thank you all for Michelle- w/ out her my return would’ve been avoided. The eye contact, warmth in connection, and professionalism is what lit the spark to make us want to return in order to indulge in whatever keepsake she penetrated through her eyes. I am forever grateful for that ounce of customer service! Sergio... I can’t say enough; a raise will do him well! As a culprit of the service industry- I can honestly say... he deserves EVERYTHING that the universe blesses him with. Had I won the last lottery- I would’ve offered him a package that would’ve had him set for life... all just to stand in my hallway as the model he is and shine! Thank you for the beautiful staff. Everyone was enduring throughout our experience. The lovely lady with the beaded necklace who seated us- down to the natural haired lady w/ the low cut- made this the ultimate encounter. Last BUT surely not least- I want to pay special attention to JoJo. Many people are NOT meant to perfect the managerial position of Manager/GM in the DMV F&B market- especially African American men. JoJo excels above both! Neither race or gender has defined his professionalism in searing this brand to the expertise in which one demands while prowling the service industry. The simple gesture of coming over and asking for feedback and introducing himself was enough. Most people like to stand behind the scenes, twiddle their thumbs and hope for the best- but JoJo was frontline- demanding customer interaction. I want to give a special thanks to JOJO for leading a team of beautiful, intelligent, experienced and well-groomed associates. His stature is a direct reflection of the ambiance that is curtailed in the space provided to enjoy the luxurious delicacies. Thank you- Thank you & THANK YOU!!
Great experience at happy hour. The drinks and the snacks were amazing. And the service was unbeatable.

Awesome food and Service! Had dinner here late February. At first I was surprised by the atmosphere, as it doesn’t carry much of a high end or intimate feel. Fairly open floor plan with a “ikea” feel. But when the food arrived all of our attention was redirected. Fresh and delicious! The staff was clearly trained to be welcoming to this new venue. Professional yet friendly. Highly recommend trying it!
Very delicious new restaurant, my friend had the vegan broil cauliflower dish I want in the opposite direction and had the ribeye totally off-the-hook very good, both dishes were excellent!

Such a fun place to stop in for a pre-concert drink or eat a great meal. Service + experience were great. The portion sizes are surprisingly large for the prices. Our favorite appetizer was the bacon wrapped dates! Highly recommend! We will be back!

We went on the day of the Grand Opening, looking for place to have our 25th anniversary, inquiring about what type of restaurant it was, and was given a  royal tour, showing us the Jospher grill, and menu right of the presses, they couldn't have been more courteous, the staff was spot on, making our night most enjoyable. Food and drinks were excellence. Well done

Highly recommend! The food was amazing and the service was top notch, which is impressive for just opening. Our server did a great job explaining the menu and recommending selections for a group to share. We had a round of appetizers and we each ordered an entree. Among the four of us we got steaks, the crab cake, and the halibut - all dishes were fantastic. My favorites were the stuffed dates and the NY strip.  We each got a few cocktails and agreed the Ab Fab was the prettiest drink we've ever seen - and it was DELICIOUS! Will definitely be back.

The food (despite this being a grill and us both being vegetarians) drinks, and service were fantastic! Our server welcomed us to their “fancy slice of Miami vice;” and the restaurant was a wood, blue, and gold version of Art Deco Miami.  and We both had a “Rum Me Over” drinks and the onion dip to start...both were light and smooth. The server then recommended the grilled cauliflower (garnished with superb mushrooms and radish, and large enough to share) and the cream of spinach (garnished with crispy fried onions and served in a small cast iron pot). Both were delicious! We then finished with the apple galette. It was all wonderful, and the servers and hosts checked several times to make sure everything went well,

The Grille was a very pleasant and filling place to eat. I had a small problem with the food and I’m not a big proponent of making a fuss of things so I kept eating and didn’t say anything. After dinner the manager came and asked if everything was ok with the food and since he asked I told him what happened. He was very apologetic and went and actually got us a piece of chocolate cake for our table to share. It was very pleasant and never had to wait on a waiter.
DISASTER!!
This place is going to be great.
